snippet: Washington’s decision to deny Hamid Aboutalebi, Iran’s choice for its next United Nations ambassador, a visa highlights the distrust that still infects the United States-Iran relationship.
abstract: Diplomatic Memo; Washington's decision to deny a visa to Hamid Aboutalebi, Iran’s choice for its next United Nations ambassador, highlights the distrust that still infects the United States-Iran relationship; Aboutalebi admits to being an interpreter and translator on a small number of occasions during the Iran hostage crisis in 1979, but says he was not part of the takeover.
lead_paragraph: Washington’s decision to deny Hamid Aboutalebi, Iran’s choice for its next United Nations ambassador, a visa highlights the distrust that still infects the United States-Iran relationship.

headline.main: Lingering Power of Hostage Crisis Short-Circuits Iranian Nominee
headline.print_headline: Lingering Power of Hostage Crisis Short-Circuits Iranian Nominee
